title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1220.25 - Authorization required for sale of merchandise, solicitation of trade, entertainment of persons or solicitation of alms
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1220.25 - Authorization required for sale of merchandise, solicitation of trade, entertainment of persons or solicitation of alms

State Regulations

No person, unless duly authorized by the Port

Authority, shall, in or upon any area, platform, stairway, station, waiting
room or any other appurtenance of the terminal: (a) sell, or offer for sale any article of
merchandise; or
(b) solicit any
business or trade, including the carrying of baggage for hire; the shining of
shoes or bootblacking; or
(c) entertain any persons by singing, dancing or playing any musical instrument; or
(d) solicit
alms. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1220.25

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
